inclusion.criterion: Histopathological documentation of prostate cancer confirmed in the Laboratory of Pathology at the: National Institutes of Health (NIH) Clinical Center prior to starting this study.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Must have non-metastatic androgen insensitive prostate cancer with a rising PSA (prostatic specific antigen) with castrate levels of testosterone and no evidence of metastatic disease on CT (computed tomography) scan or bone scan.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Life expectancy greater than or equal to 6 months.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: ECOG (Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group) performance status of 0-1.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: No systemic steroid or steroid eye drop use within 2 weeks prior to initiation of experimental therapy.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Hematological eligibility parameters: Granulocyte count greater than or equal to 1,500/mm(3).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Biochemical eligibility parameters (within 16 days of starting therapy): Hepatic function: Bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dl.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: No other active malignancies within the past 3 years (with the exception of non-melanoma skin cancers or carcinoma in situ of the bladder) or life threatening illnesses.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Willing to travel to the NIH for follow-up visits.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Able to understand and sign informed consent.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Must agree to use effective birth control (such as a condom) or abstinence during and for a period of 4 months after the last vaccination therapy. Patients must be willing to remain on chemical castration therapy, unless they have had surgical castration.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients must have recovered from acute toxicities related to prior therapy or surgery.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients should have no evidence of being immunocompromised as listed below.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Human immunodeficiency virus positivity due to the potential for decreased tolerance and may be at risk for severe side effects.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Concurrent use of topical steroids (including steroid eye drops) or systemic steroids.
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: The patient is a 63-year-old man presenting to the Emergency Department with a history of acute urinary retention in the past 2 days. Abdominopelvic CT scan revealed a large prostate and a bladder filled with urine.
